thread.title: Scaramucci ‘Most Likely’ Won’t Take White House Job, Says Trump Official - Wall Street Journal
thread.title_full: Scaramucci ‘Most Likely’ Won’t Take White House Job, Says Trump Official - Wall Street Journal

title: Scaramucci ‘Most Likely’ Won’t Take White House Job, Says Trump Official - Wall Street Journal
text:
Scaramucci’s White House Role Now Uncertain SkyBridge Capital founder said to have been offered unspecified ambassador position instead By @davidamichaels Updated Feb. 1, 2017 10:59 p.m. ET 
SkyBridge Capital founder Anthony Scaramucci, who left his role as one of Wall Street’s splashiest showmen in order to work for President Donald Trump, may not serve on the new, bigger stage after all. 
Mr. Scaramucci, who last month prominently promoted Mr. Trump’s agenda as his informal representative at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, will “most likely” not take a position in the White House, an official in the Trump administration said Wednesday. The Trump official, who asked not to be identified,... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
